formalpara.title: Description
formalpara.para: We get a domain error in DropUnmd when trying to handle an empty namespace.

formalpara.title: Analysis
formalpara.para: The DropUnmd function is called in the compiler right after the KillLines function. In the case of an empty namespace, this will result in a tree with no depth-1 subtrees. This will result in attempting to execute a first-axis catenate against an empty array with no identity element by default.

listitem.para: The appropriate fix is to ensure that the catenation never receives and empty vector of sub-trees. We manually insert an empty AST node to the head of the vector coming in, which will ensure a non-zero vector, but will not affect the results of any of the catenations in the line.
